title.narrative: 004 CHILD SENSITIVE SOCIAL PROTECTION

description.narrative: Government capacity to implement child-sensitive social protection strengthened, which contributes to Child Poverty / Public Finance For Children, Operations Support To Programme Delivery, Social Exclusion â€“ Data And Evidence, Social Protection, Social Protection And Child Poverty. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2020, Ethiopian children benefit from an improved policy environment, and evidence-informed, child-friendly, gender-sensitive and results-oriented planning and financing in support of the inclusive, sustainable and equitable realization of child rights

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Government capacity to implement child-sensitive social protection strengthened

description.narrative: UNICEF continued policy design and programme support to strengthen the national child- and gender-sensitive social protection system in the country. The UNICEF cash plus pilot (ISNP) contributed to improved linkage services for 57,631 PSNP clients in three woredas and supported 436,900 people through contributions to PSNP's shock-responsive mechanisms. As a result, access to nutrition and child protection services as well as health insurance and humanitarian aid for children in pilot regions have improved. UNICEF also successfully advocated for the vertical expansion of the Urban Productive Safety Net Programme, through provision of hygiene materials and cash top-ups to respond to CVOID-19. | Status:Met | As-of Date:24/08/2020

title.narrative: National MIS produces quarterly reports/dashboards on performance against key indicators for all districts within a month(61013)

actual.value: 2020:YesMIS in pilot regions developed by UNICEF was implemented by BOLSAs. It produces reports and dashboards on integrated case management of Permanent Direct Support and Temporary Direct Support clients.
